How is installing windows 7 going to lower your ping or "speed up your connection"?

45 ping isn't even high to worry about unless it spikes to red ping.
If you're really concerned you should revert any network setting changes you made to your modem/router if you did or check with your ISP to see if they have any problems on their end.
If you're using wireless try a wired connection instead.

Maybe refer to this http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/WlGElu7g-update-firewall-error-after-champion-select

Unless maybe you mean lag? then check if your internet usage is capped or maybe someone in the household is using up too much bandwith while you are gaming.

Windows 8, eh? Here's what you do. Go to an online store and buy a Windows 7 product key, then torrent the ISO for Windows 7 from somewhere else. Format your hard-drive and then install Windows 7.

That will legit speed up your connection. I am not kidding. Though it's probably not what you want to do.

Anyway, as far as I'm concerned, there's no tangible difference between 33 ping and 45 ping. It's best to heed this saying: "If it ain't broken, don't fix it."

But if you want to speed it up, try this. Make sure that you've recently not installed any Windows Updates or other programs which may run in the background. If so, prevent them from running.

Check your internet settings and make sure they're all in check. Mainly check for listening ports and how they listen to calls.

Hope that helps.
